snippet: For years, the artist painted some of his most majestic works along this rocky knuckle of coastline. Later this month, his studio will open to the public for the first time.
abstract: Home and studio of Winslow Homer in Prouts Neck, Maine, where the artist painted some of his most famous works of the rocky coastline, opens to the public; home was purchased by the Portland Museum of Art, which invested $2.8 million in renovations to prepare for its transition to a museum.
lead_paragraph: For years, the artist painted some of his most majestic works along this rocky knuckle of coastline. Later this month, his studio will open to the public for the first time.

headline.seo: In Maine, Walking Where Waves Moved Winslow Homer’s Brush
headline.main: In Maine, Walking Where Waves Moved Winslow Homer’s Brush
headline.print_headline: Winslow Homer’s Maine And Its Changing Seas
